alert.note: Alert for Knox; Sullivan (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 5:38AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Sullivan, northeastern Knox and northwestern Daviess Counties through 615 AM EDT... At 538 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Russellville, or 12 miles northeast of Vincennes, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Sullivan, northeastern Knox and northwestern Daviess Counties, including the following locations... Edwardsport, Freelandville, Bicknell, Oaktown and Bruceville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
